title: 'St James’s Place put my mother's life insurance up from £300 to £20k a year'
text:
Has a company treated you unfairly? Our consumer champion, Katie Morley, is here to help. For how to contact her click here.

Dear Katie,

I am extremely concerned about the ever-increasing premiums on my parents’ life insurance policy.

My father originally took it out with the J Rothschild partnership, now St James’s Place (SJP), in 1992 when he and my mother were in their early 60s.

The idea was that the policy would pay a lump sum to my sister and I when both our mother and father had passed away. Earlier this year my father, who had dementia, sadly died. My mother is now 87.

Initially the sum assured was £110,000, but this has increased over the 27 years by two and a half times to £247,000....
description: Has a company treated you unfairly?
